comments:
I'm using wtp-sdk-I-I200604062351-200604062351 and trying to import an existing WAR file.  I get the following exception and my  postOperation that I have defined is never executed.

     <extension id="myMigrationOperation"
         point="org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.OperationExtension">
      <operationExtension postOperationClass="myMigrationOperation"
id="org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.web.archive.operations.WebComponentImportOperation">
      </operationExtension>
   </extension>

Kosta, between you and Jason, can you see what's going on here?

Jason,

The exception happens because the constraint checks on the facets passed to the modify method have failed. Where there any recent changes to the logic that computes the set of facets to install? Send it back my way if you think there is framework problem here.

The first thing the import does is create a facetd project into which to import
the WAR.  It looks like this step is failing.  Tom, you are just using the WAR
import wizard right?  Are you tweaking the underlying DataModel at all?

Hi - yes, I'm just doing a simple WAR import via the wizard.  I haven't modified the model (my operation is simple and I think it fails before it even gets to my op).  Perhaps somebody else is manipulating the model?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 132036 ***
not a dupe... was trying to lookup that other defect.  :)
Neither Tom nor I can reproduce this anymore.

traces.message: One or more constraints have not been satisfied.
